item.title: 摩根大通与希腊金融科技公司在伦敦法庭胜诉
item.description: 华尔街银行摩根大通（JP Morgan）和希腊金融科技公司老板哈里斯-卡罗尼斯（Haris Karonis）周四在伦敦法庭上就如何对一家联合企业进行估值的争论中均宣称取得了成功，为其可能的出售铺平了道路。【原文：Wall Street bank JP Morgan and Greek fintech boss Haris Karonis both claimed success on Thursday in a London court battle over how to value a joint business, paving the way for its potential sale.】

item.title: 英国 Bellway 公司确认出价 83 亿美元收购竞争对手 Crest Nicholson
item.description: 英国住宅建筑商贝尔威公司（Bellway）周四证实，该公司最近提出了全股收购 Crest Nicholson 的要约，该交易对竞争对手的估值约为 65 亿英镑（82.9 亿美元）。【原文：British homebuilder Bellway on Thursday confirmed that it had recently made an all-share offer to acquire Crest Nicholson , in a deal which would have valued the rival at about 6.5 billion pounds ($8.29 billion).】

item.title: 苹果公司在诉讼中被控向加州女工支付过低薪酬
item.description: 原告律师称，苹果公司周四遭到集体诉讼，指控这家科技巨头支付给加利福尼亚州 12,000 多名女性员工的薪水低于从事类似工作的男性。【原文：Apple on Thursday was hit with a proposed class action accusing the tech giant of paying more than 12,000 female employees in California less than men with comparable jobs, lawyers for the plaintiffs said.】

item.title: 泰森食品公司在首席财务官约翰-泰森被捕后将其停职
item.description: 泰森食品公司（Tyson Foods）周四表示，在首席财务官约翰-泰森（John Tyson）因涉嫌醉酒驾驶被捕后，公司已将其停职。【原文：Tyson Foods said on Thursday that it has suspended its chief financial officer, John Tyson, after he was arrested on charges of alleged driving while intoxicated.】

item.title: 沃尔玛重新推出自有品牌时装系列，Z 世代成为关注焦点
item.description: 沃尔玛周四宣布，将重新推出一个针对 Z 世代顾客的自有品牌，以应对竞争对手，并向顾客交叉销售产品。【原文：Walmart will relaunch a private-label brand targeted at Gen Z customers, it announced on Thursday, to take on rivals and cross-sell products to customers.】

item.title: 欧洲汽车制造商面临中国对欧盟关税的报复
item.description: 欧盟委员会将从 7 月起对进口的中国产电动汽车征收高达 38.1% 的额外关税，中国政府很可能会对此举进行报复。【原文：The European Commission will apply additional duties of up to 38.1% on imported China-made electric cars from July, a move that Beijing is likely to retaliate against.】

item.title: 耶伦称维持美国经济增长需要公共和私人投资
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周四表示，吸引私人资本的美国公共投资对促进长期可持续和包容性增长至关重要，但她警告说，中国大规模国家工业补贴的模式是世界所不能接受的。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Thursday that U.S. public investments that attract private capital are crucial to promote sustainable and inclusive growth over the long term, but warned that China's model of massive state industrial subsidies were unacceptable to the world.】

item.title: 受制于规则和经济，欧盟在对华关税问题上落后于美国
item.description: 欧盟计划对中国电动汽车（EV）加征关税，这反映出欧盟对中国政府的立场更加坚定，但与美国倾向于与中国彻底脱钩的强硬立场相比，欧盟的立场还不够坚定。【原文：The European Union's plan to hike tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles (EVs) reflects a firming of its stance towards Beijing, but falls short of a tougher U.S. position tending towards an outright decoupling from China.】

item.title: 埃德蒙德-罗斯柴尔德集团将开设沙特办事处并推出债务平台
item.description: 瑞士银行埃德蒙德-罗斯柴尔德集团（Edmond de Rothschild Group）周四表示，作为资产管理和私人银行业务的专家，该集团将于今年在沙特阿拉伯开设办事处，并推出一个为当地基础设施项目提供债务融资的平台。【原文：Edmond de Rothschild Group, a specialist in asset management and private banking, is set to open an office in Saudi Arabia this year and launch a platform to provide debt finance for infrastructure projects there, the Swiss bank said on Thursday.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，富国银行因涉嫌工作造假解雇十多名员工
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四报道，富国银行上个月解雇了十多名员工，因为有人指控他们参与了模拟键盘活动，给人造成工作活跃的印象。【原文：Wells Fargo last month terminated over a dozen employees after reviewing allegations that they were involved in simulation of keyboard activity, creating an impression of active work, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局在 737 MAX 9 事件发生前对波音公司的监管 "过于放手
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）局长周四表示，在今年 1 月阿拉斯加航空公司（Alaska Airlines）一架新的 737 MAX 9 型飞机在空中发生紧急情况之前，该局对波音公司的监督 "过于放手"。【原文：The head of the Federal Aviation Administration said Thursday the agency was "too hands off" in oversight of Boeing before a January mid-air emergency in a new Alaska Airlines 737 MAX 9.】

item.title: 美国最高法院支持星巴克解雇支持工会的员工
item.description: 周四，美国最高法院在星巴克对一项司法命令提出的质疑中支持了星巴克，该命令要求星巴克重新雇用七名孟菲斯员工，因为他们试图组织工会而被解雇，这一裁决可能会使法院更难迅速制止根据联邦法律被质疑为不公平的劳工行为。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court sided on Thursday with Starbucks in the coffee chain's challenge to a judicial order to rehire seven Memphis employees fired as they sought to unionize in a ruling that could make it harder for courts to quickly halt labor practices contested as unfair under federal law.】

item.title: 全球指数编制者将欧盟债券排除在外后，欧盟借贷成本上升
item.description: 由于投资者试图评估 MSCI 将欧盟排除在其政府债券指数之外的决定对欧盟联合发行的债券意味着什么，欧盟的借贷成本周四有所上升。【原文：The European Union's borrowing costs rose on Thursday as investors tried to assess what MSCI's decision to leave the bloc out of its government bond indexes meant for jointly issued EU debt.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称波音正在调查未交付 787 飞机的质量问题
item.description: 两位熟悉此事的人士称，波音公司在发现一些未交付的787梦想飞机机身上有数百个紧固件安装错误后，正在调查787梦想飞机的新质量问题。【原文：Boeing is investigating a new quality problem with its 787 Dreamliner after discovering that hundreds of fasteners have been incorrectly installed on the fuselages of some undelivered 787 Dreamliner jets, two people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 耶伦称美国就业市场类似于疫情爆发前的环境
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周四表示，美国的就业状况越来越像COVID-19大流行之前的就业市场，工资增长放缓不会对通胀构成威胁。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on Thursday said the U.S. employment picture increasingly resembles the job market that existed prior to the COVID-19 pandemic, and slowing wage growth is not a threat to add to inflation.】

item.title: 中国奇瑞汽车公司：欧盟工厂将有助于减轻电动汽车关税
item.description: 中国出口量最大的汽车制造商奇瑞汽车公司（CHERY.UL）一位高管周四表示，该公司计划在欧洲生产的电动汽车将有助于抵消欧盟对进口中国产电动汽车征收关税的影响。【原文：Chery Auto (CHERY.UL), China's largest automaker by export volume, expects its planned production in Europe to help offset the impact of European Union tariffs on imports of China-made electric vehicles, a senior executive said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数升至10个月新高
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济的美国人数增至 10 个月来的最高点，表明劳动力市场状况有所缓解。【原文：The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits increased to a 10-month high last week, pointing to easing labor market conditions.】

item.title: 美国 5 月生产者价格意外下跌
item.description: 由于能源成本下降，5 月份美国生产者价格意外下跌，这再次表明通货膨胀在第一季度飙升之后正在减弱。【原文：U.S. producer prices unexpectedly fell in May amid lower energy costs, another indication that inflation was subsiding after surging in the first quarter.】

item.title: NHIndustries 与北约签署 6 亿欧元直升机升级协议
item.description: 总部位于法国的 NHIndustries 公司与北约直升机管理机构（NAHEMA）签署了一份价值超过 6 亿欧元（6.4818 亿美元）的合同，开发 NH90 军用直升机的升级版。【原文：NHIndustries has signed a contract worth more than 600 million euros ($648.18 million) with the NATO helicopter management agency (NAHEMA) to develop an upgrade of the NH90 military helicopter, the France-based group said.】

item.title: 人工智能芯片需求强劲，博通公司业绩飙升
item.description: 博通公司（Broadcom）周四大涨超过 13%，原因是其乐观的年度预测凸显了对用于支持以人工智能为重点的技术的芯片的无限需求，而其宣布的股票拆分也让市场更加兴奋。【原文：Broadcom surged more than 13% on Thursday as its upbeat annual forecast highlighted an insatiable demand for chips used in powering AI-focused technology, while its announcement of a stock split added to the euphoria.】

item.title: 雷诺瞄准运动型电动汽车以提高利润
item.description: 法国汽车制造商雷诺周四推出了一款电动跑车，这是该公司计划推出的一系列高端电动汽车中的第一款，它可以帮助雷诺抵御来自中国的迫在眉睫的竞争，并在这一市场表现优于其他市场的类别中抢占份额。【原文：French automaker Renault presented an electric sports car on Thursday, the first in a planned range of premium EVs, which could help it fight off looming competition from China and grab share in a category outperforming the rest of the market.】

item.title: 亚利桑那州撞车事故后，Waymo 召回 672 辆自动驾驶汽车
item.description: Alphabet 旗下 Waymo 公司周四表示，将召回 672 辆自动驾驶汽车，因为今年 5 月该公司的一辆无人驾驶汽车在亚利桑那州凤凰城撞上了一根木质电线杆。【原文：Alphabet's Waymo said Thursday it would recall 672 of its self-driving vehicles after one of its driverless vehicles struck a wooden utility pole in Phoenix, Arizona in May.】

item.title: 中国吉利对欧盟关税决定表示失望，誓言采取 "必要措施 "维护权益
item.description: 中国汽车制造商吉利汽车（GEELY.UL）周四对欧盟决定提高中国产电动汽车关税表示 "非常失望"，并誓言采取 "一切必要措施 "维护自身合法权益。【原文：Chinese automaker Geely (GEELY.UL) on Thursday expressed "great disappointment" in the European Union's decision to increase tariffs on Chinese-made electric vehicles, vowing "all necessary measures" to safeguard its legitimate rights.】

item.title: 外国信用卡交易为委内瑞拉增加了稀缺的美元流通量
item.description: 委内瑞拉政府为控制两位数的通货膨胀率，锁定了汇率，四位公共部门和金融界人士说，用外国信用卡支付的交易正在帮助更多的外汇在委内瑞拉流通。【原文：Transactions paid with foreign credit cards are helping circulate more foreign currency in Venezuela, where the government has locked in an exchange rate as part of efforts to control double-digit inflation, four public sector and finance sources said.】

item.title: 3M 将向 Met Tower Life Insurance 转移约 25 亿美元的美国养老金债务
item.description: 3M 公司周四表示，将向 Metropolitan Tower Life Insurance 公司转移约 25 亿美元的美国养老金支付义务以及近 2.3 万名美国退休人员和受益人的相关计划资产。【原文：3M said on Thursday it would transfer about $2.5 billion of its U.S. pension payment obligations and related plan assets for nearly 23,000 U.S. retirees and beneficiaries to Metropolitan Tower Life Insurance.】

item.title: 独家报道高盛旨在将私人银行富裕客户的贷款额度翻番
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）私人银行业务负责人告诉路透社，该公司的目标是在未来五年内将其向账户规模超过 1,000 万美元的超富裕私人银行客户提供的贷款增加一倍，因为该公司将收集更多存款来增加贷款。【原文：Goldman Sachs aims to double its lending over the next five years to ultra-wealthy private bank clients with account sizes exceeding $10 million, as it gathers more deposits to supercharge lending, the bank's private banking chief told Reuters.】

item.title: 纳斯达克期货大涨，科技股涨势抵消了美联储的谨慎态度
item.description: 尽管美联储预计今年只会降息一次，但市场对美联储在 9 月份放宽利率的押注基本未变，受此影响，重量级科技股上涨，周四纳斯达克指数期货大涨。【原文：Futures tracking the Nasdaq leapt on Thursday on gains in heavyweight technology stocks, aided by broadly unchanged bets on the Federal Reserve easing interest rates in September despite the central bank projecting just one cut this year.】

item.title: 受关税影响，特斯拉预计将提高中国制造汽车在欧盟的售价
item.description: 特斯拉汽车制造商周四在其网站上表示，由于欧盟将对中国制造的汽车征收进口关税，特斯拉预计将提高Model 3的价格，但没有说明涨价的幅度。【原文：Tesla expects to increase the price of its Model 3 because of import duties to be levied by the E.U. on cars made in China, the carmaker said on its website on Thursday, without specifying the size of the price hike.】

item.title: 如何让你的日子更有成效
item.description: 说到生产力，你会想到什么？【原文：When you think of productivity, what comes to mind?】

item.title: 在新的预测中，美联储似乎将退出大选周期
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会可能刚刚躲开了总统竞选活动的聚光灯，一组新的预测显示，在大选日之后才有可能降息。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve may have just ducked out of the presidential campaign spotlight with a fresh set of forecasts showing no interest rate cuts are likely until after Election Day.】
